fields.summary: Hive HBase query fails on Tez due to missing jars - part 2

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

fields.summary: custom jars for Hive query should be uploaded to scratch dir per query; and/or versioned

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.description: Tez paths in Hive never call configure on the input/output operators, so (among other things, potentially) requisite files never get added to the job
fields.summary: Hive HBase query fails on Tez due to missing jars and then due to NPE in getSplits

comments.body: preliminary patch. Need to set up cluster to test this (and later remove logging), haven't done so far
Nm, it iterates work graph incorrectly on review now.
Will attach updated patch today which fixes the issue and also another one with NPE in getSplits

patch that provides files to AM and vertices, and also makes sure correct configs are set to avoid NPE. 
The part for AM may change in response to better Tez APIs...

Updated patch. Note that this depends on a feature in yet-unreleased Tez 0.4; if that ships first I will update pom, otherwise it will be split into two patches. We will commit restart-AM path here, and relocalize path separately in Hive 0.14

ATTACHMENT ID: 12637961

Pacth with the test. Test with one of the Tez's own files (or guava, which is what I tried first) passes. However, the conflict test fails, so it's not really valid. DAG passes despite having guava-named, or tez-named, bogus jar added to resources. 
Given that I saw it work in cluster I wonder if some test setup issues are causing this. Do you guys have an idea? I will look tomorrow otherwise.
Splitting the patch; this part has the original workaround and doesn't depend on new tez apis
this is the diff btw https://reviews.apache.org/r/19789/
